questions.question: What is the Prototype Design Pattern?
options: A design pattern used in software development
A design pattern used in game development
A design pattern used in graphical user interfaces
A design pattern used in database operations

questions.question: How is the Prototype Design Pattern used in software development?
options: To create new game characters by copying existing character templates
To create copies of GUI components to save time and resources
To clone database records with similar attributes
To implement cloning mechanisms for object creation

questions.question: In which context can the Prototype Design Pattern be used?
options: Game development
Graphical user interfaces
Database operations
All of the above

questions.question: What is one benefit of using the Prototype Design Pattern in game development?
options: Creating similar characters with different attributes
Saving time and resources when generating similar UI elements
Cloning database records with similar attributes
Implementing cloning mechanisms for object creation

questions.question: When working with databases, what can the Prototype Design Pattern be used for?
options: Creating new game characters by copying existing character templates
Creating copies of GUI components to save time and resources
Cloning database records with similar attributes
Implementing cloning mechanisms for object creation

questions.question: What is one drawback of using the Prototype Design Pattern?
options: Requires clients to have knowledge of the specifics of object creation
Not applicable in database operations
Involves implementing cloning mechanisms to create new instances based on prototype objects
Cannot be used in game development
